intro: Cousinia iranshahrii, commonly known as the Iranian高山火绒草, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features narrow, silver-green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cousinia iranshahrii is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local herbal medicine.
